    "# Packages"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "from scipy.stats import bernoulli\n",
    "import seaborn as sb"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Bernoulli distribution"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# Self-defined bernoulli function\n",
    "def self_bernoulli(success_p, success = True):\n",
    "    '''\n",
    "    success_p: success probability of an event, float number\n",
    "    success: indicate whether an event is successful or fail, boolean values\n",
    "    '''\n",
    "    return (success_p**(success))*((1-success_p)**(1-success))"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 3,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "Success probability is 0.4\n",
      "Failure probability is 0.6\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# For instance, if the success probability is 0.4 and therefore we get the success probability 0.4.\n",
    "# Otherwise, the probability is 0.6 for failure.\n",
    "print('Success probability is',self_bernoulli(0.4, success = True))\n",
    "print('Failure probability is',self_bernoulli(0.4, success = False))"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 4,
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",
     "text": [
      "0.78\n",
      "0.22\n",
      "0.6\n",
      "0.4\n"
     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Or can use the bernoulli module\n",
    "print(bernoulli.pmf(p = 0.22, k = 0))\n",
    "print(bernoulli.pmf(p = 0.22, k = 1))\n",
    "\n",
    "print(bernoulli.pmf(p = 0.4, k = 0))\n",
    "print(bernoulli.pmf(p = 0.4, k = 1))"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Visualization of bernoulli distribution"

  },

   ],
   "source": [
    "# Visualization of random 50 data draw from a bernoulli distribution\n",
    "data = bernoulli.rvs(size=50, p=0.6)\n",
    "ax = sb.distplot(data, kde=True, color='crimson', hist_kws={\"linewidth\": 25,'alpha':1})\n",
    "ax.set(title='Bernouli Distribution', ylabel='Frequency')"
   ]
  },
